newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sandoz unit to stop use of gene vitamin.
newsitem.headline: Sandoz unit to stop use of gene vitamin.

text.p: Sandoz AG's Wander Group unit will cease using a genetically modified vitamin in a line of baby foods until a determination is made on whether the products require Swiss government approvals, a Sandoz spokesman said.
The Vitamin B12 used in the products is produced by Rhone-Poulenc Rorer and distributed in Switzerland by Roche Holding AG, the Sandoz spokesman said.
He said the company was convinced that the product was 100 percent safe, nonetheless a conventionally produced vitamin will be used in the products until the regulatory question is answered.

The spokesman also stressed that the vitamin products in question are modified in a way that results in increased volumes, but no foreign genes are introduced to the vitamin. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
